CHAPTER 4-6
ASSIGNMENT  OF  BUILDING  NUMBERS
4-6-1
DESIGNATION
Buildings on the east or north side of any street or avenue shall be given even numbers, and
the buildings on the west or south side thereof shall be given odd numbers.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §1, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-2
CENTRAL POINT
All buildings on the streets and avenues of the City shall be numbered, commencing from
Holly Boulevard, or the southern East-West portion of Sylvan Circle and Sioux Boulevard,
and shall be numbered north, south, east and west from said Holly Boulevard or the
southern East-West portion of Sylvan Circle and Sioux Boulevard, as the case may be, as
far as said streets or avenues may be extended.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §2, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-3
BLOCK LENGTH
For the purpose of establishing a building numbering system within the City of Brandon,
a block length shall be four hundred forty (440) feet or three equal divisions of every one-
fourth (1/4) section totaling twelve equal divisions of every section north and south and east
and west.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §3, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-4
NUMBERING NORTH AND SOUTH STREETS
On all streets and avenues intersecting or lying perpendicular or approximately
perpendicular to Holly Boulevard or the southern East-West portion of Sylvan Circle or
extensions thereof, the block or equal divisions shall be numbered north or south as the case
may be with the first block or equal division north or south being numbered one hundred
(100) and the numbers shall increase at the rate of one hundred for each additional block
or equal division.  The first number to the north or south of any equal division of said
streets and avenues running north and south shall be a multiple of one hundred, and there
from within each block or equal division the buildings or lots shall be numbered
consecutively to the north or south as the case may be.  To designate the numbers on streets
or avenues running north and south of Holly Boulevard or the southern East-West portion
of Sylvan Circle, the words "North" or "South" shall be placed between the number and
name of the street or avenue, according as the same may be north or south of said Holly
Boulevard and the southern East-West portion of Sylvan Circle.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §4, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.

4-6-5
NUMBERING EAST AND WEST STREETS
On all streets and avenues intersecting or lying perpendicular or approximately
perpendicular to Sioux Boulevard or extensions thereof, the blocks or equal divisions shall
be numbered east or west as the case may be with the first block or equal division east or
west being numbered one hundred (100) and the numbers shall increase at the rate of one
hundred for each additional block or equal division.  The first number to the east or west
of any equal division of said streets or avenues running east and west shall be a multiple of
one hundred, and there from within each block or equal division the buildings or lots shall
be numbered consecutively to the east or west as the case may be.  To designate the numbers
on streets or avenues running east and west of Sioux Boulevard, the words "East" or "West"
shall be placed between the number and name of the street or avenue, according as the same
may be east or west of said Sioux Boulevard.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §5, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-6
ISSUANCE
The Municipal Finance Officer is hereby authorized and directed to issue numbers for each
building, business place, dwelling house or lot fronting on a street or avenue in the City in
accordance with the provisions of this ordinance.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §6, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-7
NUMBERING INTERVALS
From the portion of each block or equal division nearest its respective central point, each

building or lot shall be assigned specific numbers in ascending order and in intervals of
four.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §7, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-8
NUMBERS TO BE DISPLAYED
Every person having a home or business establishment within the City is hereby required
to display in a prominent place upon the front of his home or business establishment the
street number assigned by the Municipal Finance Officer as provided in this ordinance.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §8, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-9
SPECIFICATIONS FOR NUMBERS
The street number displayed by each person on a single family dwelling, pursuant to the
provisions of this article shall not be less than two (2) inches in width and not less than
three (3) inches in height, and clearly visible from the street.
The street number displayed by each person on a multi-family or commercial building
pursuant to the provisions of this article shall not be less than four (4) inches in width and
not less than six (6) inches in height, and clearly visible from the street.

Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §9, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
Ordinance No. 393, §9, 11/14/06.
4-6-10
COST ASSESSED
If the owner or occupant of any dwelling house, building, business establishment or lot
fronting on a street or avenue within the City shall fail, refuse or neglect to place the
number, or replace the number when necessary, the Municipal Finance Officer may cause
a notice to be personally served on him by registered mail to the last known address
ordering him to do so.  In case of failure of such owner or occupant to comply with such
notice within ten (10) days after the date of such service of notice, the Municipal Finance
Officer may cause the same to be done, and assess the cost thereof against the property or
premises numbered.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §10, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
4-6-11
ADDRESS NUMBERS FOR LOTS
Each lot shall be assigned an address number in accordance with the numbering
system in effect in the City.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance No. 79, §11, 4/16/79.
SDCL § 9-45-2.
